snippet: Of roughly 4,000 tuberculosis patients tested, a third of those with new cases and half of those with previously treated cases had drug-resistant strains of the disease.
abstract: Survey by the Chinese Center for Disease Control published in New England Journal of Medicine finds that China has a serious epidemic of drug-resistant tuberculosis.
lead_paragraph: Of roughly 4,000 tuberculosis patients tested, a third of those with new cases and half of those with previously treated cases had drug-resistant strains of the disease.

headline.seo: Drug-Resistant Tuberculosis on the Rise in China
headline.main: China: Survey Reveals a Growing Number of Drug-Resistant Tuberculosis Cases
headline.print_headline: China: Survey Reveals a Growing Number Of Drug-Resistant Tuberculosis Cases
